item.title: Preventing Harassment through Outbound Number Enforcement Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 173.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7895)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7895-7896)

summary.text:
Amends the federal criminal code to prohibit the generating or transmitting of: (1) false caller ID information with the intention of wrongfully obtaining anything of value; or (2) caller ID information pertaining to a person or entity without consent and with the intention of deceiving the recipient of a call about the identity of the caller.

Prohibits, with certain exceptions, selling any service that enables users to modify, generate, or transmit false or misleading caller ID information or attempting or conspiring to do so.

bill.title: A bill to prohibit the sale or provision of caller ID spoofing services.

item.title: A bill to prohibit the sale or provision of caller ID spoofing services.
A bill to prohibit the sale or provision of caller ID spoofing services.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7895)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
